turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Excused.  Open the cabinet to your left. You will find appropriate attire.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Can do.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: No!  No!  I can't do this!

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Normally dressed, you are a sore thumb, and you endanger us all.  While you are here, you will conduct yourself as a nun. Only I shall know who, and what, you truly are.  You will not disrupt the convent.  You will not influence the Sisters with your colorful street talk. You will draw no attention to yourself in any way.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: But look at rites  Look at this!  I'm a nun!  I'm invisible!  I'm a penguin!

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: As of now, and until you leave, you are Sister Mary Clarence.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Mary Clarence?  Like a guy?  Like a dumb guy?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: The Mary is in deference to the Holy Mother, the Clarence in honor of Saint Clarence Loyola.  There are three vows that every nun must accept.  The vow of poverty...

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: No problem.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: The vow of obedience.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Like to who?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: And the vow of chastity.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: I'm outta here.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Sisters, for the rest of the day we shall declare a Vow of Silence.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: A what?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Surely you are familiar with this practice, Mary Clarence.  Only when our lips are silent, can our prayers truly be heard.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Silence?  No talking?  All day?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Until sundown.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: As a new member of our order, I think you might also enjoy a ritual fast.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: A what?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: A fast.  To remind us of the poor, of those who must endure without enough to eat.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: No food?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: No food.  Not until sundown.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Is this all the food I get?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Yes.  Until breakfast.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: That's tomorrow!  Don't you have any snacks?  Machines?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: This shall be your cell, Mary Clarence.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: My what?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Your cell.  Your room.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: You were right the first time.  Is this like, solitary?  The cooler?  Where's the furniture?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Our lives are simple.  We have little need for material possessions.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Right, sure thing.  But what about, like, appliances?  Like a little color portable?  Boom box?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Useless distractions.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: It's like the Stone Age.  The room time forgot.  What about a phone?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: And whom would you call?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Oh, I don't know... Satan?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Your cell is more than adequate.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Right.  So what do we do now?  Ping- Pong?  Row over to the monastery?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: It is nine p.m.  Pleasant dreams.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Wait.  No.  You're kidding.  Lights out? At nine?  My day's just starting.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: I'm sure.  If I were you, I would use this time, to think about my life.  And its direction.  Or lack thereof.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: What's wrong with my life?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: From all I've heard, just about everything.  Your singing career seems all but nonexistent, and your married lover wants you dead.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Girls, this is Sister Mary Clarence. She'll be minding you until Sister Mary Patrick's return.  Mary Clarence, please assign a biblical passage.  Do not attempt discussion.  Am I understood?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: I got it.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Come, Sister.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Deal with it, sweet thing.  It's important, nowadays.  You just practice at home, with a balloon and a banana.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Mary Clarence!

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: A balloon and a banana!  Tell me, Mary Clarence, what were you thinking?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Those girls were asking questions. They've got it rough.  I wish somebody had talked to me about that stuff when was their age.  I wish somebody would talk to me about it now.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: This is a convent, not a clinic.  We offer moral guidance, not hardware.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Have you been out in those streets?  Do you know what those kids are up against? You should help them!

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: We are nuns.  We seek solutions through prayer.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Sometimes it's not enough!

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: You are correct.  Sometimes prayer alone cannot help a situation.  Such as your own, for example.  How do you feel about physical labor?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: It never solves anything.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Do your recall the words of Saint Peter, in Ecciesiastes 1:27?  He spoke unto a wastrel youth.  He said, "Take up thy task, and know ye the path of contentment."

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: In English?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: How to put it... ah, Of course, Mary Clarence.  "No pain, no gain."

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Really catching on.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Good.  Mary Patrick, I need you in the office.  Mary Clarence, carry on.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: I'm sorry, I'm not a weaver!

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Months of work, and the loom, absolutely ruined!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Look, this isn't my kind of thing!  I wasn't cut out to make little tapestries, or knit little sweaters! I don't do that! I'm a star!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: So... hi there.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: I don't believe we have anything to say to each other.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Look... I know I shouldn't have, I'm incredibly sorry about Mary Robert, I wasn't thinking, I didn't know that would happen!

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Mary Robert's life was in danger! Your behavior was inexcusable!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: I know!  I'm sorry   I didn't mean for it to happen!  And I was the one they were shooting at!

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Mary Clarence, I have given you every opportunity.  To change.  To make a decent life for yourself.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: A decent life?  Excuse me?  As what?  A janitor?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Clearly, you have learned nothing. And you present an ongoing threat, both to this convent and to yourself.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: But you can't kick me out!  Guys want to kill me!  You're a nun!  A big nun! Aren't you supposed to have compassion? For the wayward sheep?  I mean, I'm a major sinner!  All-time great!  Hall of Fame!  Aren't I, like, your dream come true?  Your Olympic event?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Mary Clarence, perhaps you are correct.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: I am?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: You may stay.  But I shall restrict your activities to but a single task.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: You have, I believe, some minimal background in music.  Therefore, you are to join our choir.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: You will sing, and you will sleep,' that is your schedule until you depart.  As almost no one attends Mass, you will be unable to cause further damage.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: No.  No.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: You're my Olympic event.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Not the choir, please, anything but that.  The choir -- I mean, have you heard them?  I'll do anything, scrub floors, toilets, you name it, but not that I

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: The choir, Mary Clarence.  Go for the gold.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: I was thinking Las Vegas.  Get some butts in those seats.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: And what next?  Popcorn?  Curtain calls? This is not a theater.  or a casino.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Exactly.  People like going to theaters and casinos.  But they think church is for Grandma -- we could change that. Pack the joint.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Through blasphemy?  You have corrupted the entire choir!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Hold on.  That's not fair.  I worked hard with them.  They gave up their free time, and they loved it.  Those women are happy.  And we can get even better.  We can wake this place up.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Out of the question.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Please let me try.  I'm begging you.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: And I am refusing.  As of tomorrow, Mary Lazarus will resume her leadership of the choir.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: And on such an occasion, I feel a completely traditional program will be best.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: The council of Cardinals is perhaps the most esteemed body in the entire Catholic church.  They command the utmost respect. Your more... secular entertainment would be wholly out of place.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Isn't that why we were asked to sing for those Cardinals?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: I believe this can be settled by a simple vote.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: A vote?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Of course.  Mary Clarence, a convent is not a totalitarian state.  Most major decisions are made by the membership as a whole.  A membership that, I am certain, will vote in a rational and pious manner. All those in favor of allowing Mary Clarence to select a program?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: But... wait a minute...

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: The majority has spoken.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: You sent for me?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: You have a phone call.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Hey -- your prayers have been answered. I'm leaving.  In just a couple of days.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Really.  Well, that makes two of us.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: I have submitted my resignation to Bishop O'Hara.  Privately.  I have asked to be relocated as soon as possible.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: But -- why?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: I must go where I can be of use.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: But -- there's so much more to do right here.  And look, if it's about me, I mean, I'm gone.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Indeed.  After how long?  A few weeks? I have been here thirty years.  And yet, it would seem, I know nothing.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: But everything that's happening is good! You can be a part of it!

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: A part of what?  Mary Clarence, it is one thing to rabble rouse, to sweep into town and declare a holiday.  You have raised the Sisters' expectations, you have excited and confused them.  They imagine this neighborhood to be some sort of delightful ongoing block party.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: You and I know that life is not so simple.  There will be disappointments. Rude shocks.  And you will have vanished. How... fortunate.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Okay, so I just got things started.  But you could build on that.  You could keep it going.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: I am sorry, Mary Clarence.  I seem to have misplaced my tambourine.  Good day, Mary Clarence.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: But...

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Good day.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Saving you.  Move!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Reverend Mother -- Thank-you.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Oh?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: You saved my life.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: I'm a Christian.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Then I guess you're stuck.  Life sentence.  No parole.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Very well.  I hold you responsible for all of this, For introducing a lounge act into my convent.  For utterly disrupting our way of life.  And for placing all of us in mortal danger.  Thank-you.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: I don't think so.  What about skydiving? A crank call to Billy Graham?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: You have evidenced great maturity, Mary Robert.  We shall have a serious discussion.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: What about me, Reverend Mother?  I think you were right.  I'm just a bad influence.  Sister show biz.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Perhaps not.  Perhaps we can all use... a little Spandex.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Really?  And maybe shorter habits, and women priests, and sleeping late?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Don't push it.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: From Vince?  What a guy.  Doo-lang, doo- lang.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: At least he's not a cop.  At least he can afford a decent gift.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I used to buy.you,..stuff.  On your birthday .  When we were seeing each other.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Yeah, like what?  Quilted coat hangers, that your mother picked out?  Lottery tickets?  A travel iron?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: So I don't shop.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: 'Cause you're always out, arresting people.  Making trouble.  I don't know why I went out with you in the first place, it was embarrassing!  I couldn't hold my head up, I used to tell people you were a security guard!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Oh, yeah? Well, how do you think I felt? You were singing in bowling alleys back then.  I told people you were a hooker!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: He's a businessman.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: A what? When are you qonna wake up?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: When are you gonna get off my case? Have you got a search warrant?  What do you want -- cheap thrills?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Information, baby.  I thought maybe somebody around here might have a conscience.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Think again!  And get out of here.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Right between the eyes!  Down and out! The guy was gone!  I... I couldn't believe it!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You couldn't believe it?  Vince the Prince?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: I never said he was an altar boy, okay? But he sent his goons after me!  They tried to kill me!  I'm not kidding!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: I don't know anything about bodies!  I mean, he didn't bring it home.  He was good to me... sometimes.  He was sweet. He took care of me.  Who am I supposed to go out with?  He owns a casino.  He let me sing.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: He didn't do you a favor.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Screw you!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: And if I don't?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Then-you run.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Ten flights?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You'd lose.  You'd die.  All over the sidewalk.  And into the street.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: All right!  I get the picture!  I'll do it!  I'll testify!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Get a stenographer.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Okay, here's what I want.  I know about this stuff.  A five-star hotel.  With room service.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Maybe Hawaii.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Jesus, what do you think this is -- Wheel of Fortune?  Let me spell it out for you.  You have to hide like you don't even exist.  You have to get so far hidden away that you never see sunlight.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Okay -- no limo.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: No nothing.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: What're you gonna do, put me in a bag and bury me?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I'm gonna put you in the last place on Earth that Vince would ever look for you.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: I hate you.  I totally hate you.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Safest place in the world.  You think Vince would look for you here?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Nuns, Eddie.  There are nuns here. Everywhere.  It's crawling with 'em.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: It's a convent.  All you have to do is shut up, behave yourself, and get along.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: With nuns?  With rulers?  No way.  I'm gonna go back, work things out with Vince.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: And one bullet.  That's all it's gonna take.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: But Vince has contacts all over the place!  This is San Francisco!  They'll be looking for me!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Everywhere but this little hole-in-the- wall convent.  Nobody knows you're here but me.  We're trying to get a quick court date.  A month, maybe two, tops. I'll spring you as soon as I can.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: I can't stay here!  I'll crack up! Eddie, what am I gonna do?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Pray.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Eddie, you've got to get me out of here.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Not again.  You can't keep calling. Somebody's going to catch on to where you are.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: But I'm going insane!  All these people do is pray and work, work and pray!  I don't get it -- when's the weekend? They have gruel, Eddie, that's what they call food!  Gruel -- it's like Alpo for nuns! I sleep in a cell, on a board, and I pray five times a days  Do you know what I pray for, Eddie, do you have any idea? Check your crotch, Eddie --anything fall off yet?  Get me outta her!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Calm down.  Look, I didn't want to tell you this, but we've had some problems with our protection program lately.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Keeping our witnesses alive.  We hide them, but there's a leak in the department, and they end up dead.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: You son-of-a-bitch!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I just need a few more weeks,

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: But it's a nightmare!  Mother Superior is out to get me!  She hates my guts! She keeps thinking up new kinds of torture!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Do you hear that?  That choir?  Eddie, in here, that's what they call music!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Don't call again.  It's not safe.  I'll be in touch.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: What'd she say?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You blew it -- big time.  She doesn't want you back.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Does she know people are trying to kill me out there?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: She's counting on it.  She's concerned for your safety, but she wants me to try and find another convent that will take you. Or a carnival.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: So what am I supposed to do in the meantime?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Go in and talk to her.  It can't hurt.  Go.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Eddie!  You scared the hell out of me!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: What if I was Vince?  You'd be dead right now.  What are you doing giving interviews on TV?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: It wasn't my fault!  They just showed up.  It's helping the convent.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You're supposed to be hiding out!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: I really can't talk about it now.  The place is packed.  SRO.  I've got a show to do.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Listen to yourself.  This isn't a career opportunity.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: I know that.  This isn't about me.  It's about the choir.  You should hear them. They're good.  Really good.  And I taught them.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Jesus, look at you   You're glowing.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: I am?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Yeah.  You look... great.  I mean it..

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Really?  Lieutenant?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I've been worried about you.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: You mean -- worried about my testimony?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: No -- worried about you.  Personally.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Well..  thanks.  I've been thinking about you.. - sometimes.  I mean, there aren't a lot of guys around here.  I mean, sometimes I feel like... a nun.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Me too.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: You're not... seeing anybody?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: No.  Most of the time I'm thinking about you.  And now... you've really changed.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: I have?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You re sort of... radiant.   your eyes are shining.  You're rea1ly different...

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: I've got to go.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Just remember - you're a target.  Don't you think Vince has a T.V.?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: I know, I know.  I'll be careful.  I'll try.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Vince knows you're here.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Long story.  His goons will be here any minute.  We've got to get you out of here '- now!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: I can't go with you.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: I've got a show -- at St. Matthew's Cathedral.  We're singing for the Cardinals.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You're gonna be singing for St. Peter if you don't get your ass out of here!

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Eddie -- I've got to go back.  They won't sing without me.  I'm deserting them.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I think they'd understand.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: That's not the point!  They need me!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: They need you?  A bunch of nuns?  For what?  Moral guidance?  Make-up tips?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: You don't get it!  It's a big thing for them, it's like... Caesar's Palace. Prime-time.  They're singing for the Cardinals.  It's like... "Star Search." If first prize was a trip to the Vatican. They've worked really hard, they deserve this.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Nuns?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: What're you doing?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Even nuns have to pee.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Don't you have a concert to go to?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: That depends.  Sisters, you don't know this, but Reverend Mother's been making all sorts of noises about resigning. That's bad news.  I don't know if we could sing, if we thought that was true.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Yeah, Eddie, thanks a whole bunch. Thanks for sticking me in a convent.  So you think, after all this, maybe I really am a nun?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I don't know.  There's only one way to be absolutely sure.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Yeah, like what?

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Hey, girls.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK AND ROBERT
turns.text: Hail, Mary.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: Jerusalem is a real drag.  Everybody hates me.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK AND ROBERT
turns.text: Oh-huh.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: People throw stones.  They call me names.  I mean, really.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK AND ROBERT
turns.text: Really.

turns.speaker: CHRISTY
turns.text: But -- wait.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: We could put you into our witness protection program.

turns.speaker: TATE
turns.text: A hiding place.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Then one day they find you.

turns.speaker: TATE
turns.text: They open a window.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Jesus.  Data-base hoods.  It's a wonderful world.  Beloved daughter missing.  Reward of two hundred and fifty thousand dollars. Please find our adored angel, we miss her so.  Dead or alive.

turns.speaker: TATE
turns.text: Vince is getting desperate.  Where is she, Eddie?  Where'd you stash her?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Where's who?

turns.speaker: TATE
turns.text: You won't even tell us?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I wouldn't even tell the Pope.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: We're looking for Mike.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: You found him -- but we're not open yet.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: I'm sorry -- I don't know what gets into him.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Who are you guys?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: We're the guys from Vegas.  You had Christy last night, but you let her get away.  It's upsetting.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: But you didn't tell me!

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: We didn't tell you what?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: That she's a nun!  That chick you're looking for -- she's a nun!

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: A nun?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I'm telling you!

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Vince -- is she... okay?

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: And if she runs?

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: Take care of it.

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: He's so damn cocky.  This is different.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: It's a bluff, Vince.

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: You know so much.  They've got Christy, and we've got to find her.  Get her 8x10, from in front of the lounge.  Fax it to every contact we got.

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: It's done?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Not... totally.

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: What's the problem?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: But, Vince, how do you know she didn't like, join up and become a nun when she was in that convent?

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: It didn't happen.

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: I can't believe this.  Okay, I want both you guys to go back there, and both of you shoot her at the same time.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Yeah...

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: Well?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: It didn't work, Vince.

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: You were both supposed to put your guns to her head and shoot.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: So, take it off.

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: I'm telling you, she's not a nun!  Get her out of the nun outfit, and put her in some clothes.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Maybe pants.

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: Get her!

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Which one!

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: There she is!

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Which one?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: I can't see anything in here!

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: Willy -- hit the lights.

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: Joey?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Where is she?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: But, boss -- she's still, you know, a nun.

turns.speaker: VINCE
turns.text: She's a broad!  Got it!  Just some broad!

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: So that guy in the bar was right?  She's like... some kind of nun?

turns.speaker: WILLY
turns.text: Yeah, right -- when I see it.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: She's gettin' away!

turns.speaker: WILLY
turns.text: Forget her!  We got the one we need! Step on it!

turns.speaker: WILLY
turns.text: She was real quiet and peaceful all the way back in the car.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: No smart-ass remarks or nothing.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: You didn't shoot!

turns.speaker: WILLY
turns.text: Neither did you!

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: I figured if you were gonna, then I wouldn't have to.

turns.speaker: WILLY
turns.text: That's what I figured, too.

turns.speaker: WILLY
turns.text: Strip down a nun?  You want us to fry?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: For like, twelve zillion eternities?

turns.speaker: WILLY
turns.text: A sweater.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: And then we can ice her.  No nun, no evil eye.

turns.speaker: WILLY
turns.text: What's she doing?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: She's praying.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: Are you going to shoot us all, tough guy?

turns.speaker: MARY LAZARUS
turns.text: Is it worth it?  A lot of witnesses here.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: It should be here any minute.

turns.speaker: MARY LAZARUS
turns.text: Dress rehearsal at four, performance at 8:30.  Sharp.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: We sound terrible   We need Mary Clarence.

turns.speaker: MARY LAZARUS
turns.text: We're losing it.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: Look what she did with the choir.  She made us sing beautifully.

turns.speaker: MARY LAZARUS
turns.text: That should have tipped us.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: We've got to save her!

turns.speaker: MARY LAZARUS
turns.text: We can't leave it up to the Feds!

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Yes, Mary Patrick?

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: Reverend Mother, on behalf of the sisters, I'd like to welcome Mary Clarence to St. Katherine's.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Sister Mary Patrick?

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: I need to see you, at once.  Girls, please excuse Sister Mary Patrick for a few moments.  Mary Clarence?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Mary Clarence -- how is your weaving progressing?

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: Oh, she's doing just fine, Reverend Mother -

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: Bless her!  There are so many problems in this neighborhood that we could help solve.  That's why many of us became nuns.  It's marvelous, Reverend Mother.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Really...

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: She shouldn't have come back.  She knew she was in danger.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: But -- why would anyone kidnap a nun?

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: She told us about one.  The Little Sisters of the Moonlight.  In Las Vegas.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: All right.  It's a beginning.  Las Vegas, Nevada.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: Peace on Earth.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: However, we can also pray for other things.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: Measles.

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Is this like your old convent?

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: Which convent was that, Sister?

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: Mary Clarence has a background in music. That's what Reverend Mother said.

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: Really, Mary Clarence?  Were you a choirmistress?

turns.speaker: MARY PATRICK
turns.text: We did it!  We actually sang a chord!

turns.speaker: MARY ROBERT
turns.text: That was exciting!
